Articles.Content:
47 minutes ago, DMagic said:

@cicatrix I would need to see the log file. That there aren't any errors specifically related to the mod doesn't mean something isn't wrong.

Here:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WMYO42_iZerDoVq1Q90Asfkn_mCgWg9g/view?usp=sharing

@cicatrix You are missing the ContractParser dependency from your GameData/DMagicUtilities folder. I'm not sure how that could have happened when installing through CKAN, as it is set as a dependency there. You could try deleting Contracts Window + and reinstalling, or just manually install Contract Parser, or manually install Contracts Window + from Space Dock, which includes all of its dependencies.

Re-installed Contract Parser. This is probably the issue with CKAN and my crooked hands, apparently.

The problem is solved, thank you for your help and for your great mods!

Uhm. After reading the first few and last few pages I have what may be an odd question:

Could it be (made?) possible to remove the bar above contracts? I really dig the idea behind the mod, but it throws so much in my face I find myself using the stock window more despite it being frustrating as well. 
So many buttons, and the orange text, and the see-through background, it's too much going on at once

The very first screenshots of this mod missed a lot of features, sure, but they were a lot less 'loud'.

Ps. I realize that it may sound petty or spoiled, but for my brain it would make a world of difference.

I searched the thread for posts regarding performance issues and some seem to highlight that performance has been improved. Even with only one contract visible in the window (I made a custom mission list and that's what I'm displaying) is lags like crazy. My FPS when sitting on the KSC screen (all buildings visible) drops from around 135 FPS to 50 FPS when I drag the window around. If I display all my contracts (only 29 currently active) and drag the window around I watch the FPS drop to 20 and it keeps dropping. Is there anything wrong with my game/mods/install? Or is the performance still an issue?

Something else I noticed when making custom missions and adding contracts to those missions - after the first 5 missions in the list, the dropdown menu doesn't have a texture anymore. Present with both stock and non-stock UIs. Images of the issue here.

I'm running on 1.7.2. Log file is here. Thanks. 

Edited July 7, 2019 by madindehead

Contracts Window 9.3 is out; get it on Space Dock.

This update includes French translations by don-vip. It also fixes a few bugs related to the mission list popup windows not accommodating more than 4 or 5 missions. It also fixes some weird behavior when you apply the stock game settings while Contracts Window + is closed, along with behaving better when switching between the two different UI styles.

@DMagic thanks for this mod. I only installed it a few days ago, but it already so useful.  As a question or possibly a feature request... is there any way to filter the list of contracts to only see those that have not been assigned to any mission?

 

Again... thank you for all you do.

Contracts Window + version 9.4 is out; get it on Space Dock.

It has been update to support KSP 1.8.

Its dependencies Progress Parser and Contract Parser have also been updated and are included in the download package.

Pretty sure it's me just being a bit dense (VoidSquids are not famous to be known as the universe's smartest creatures), but: what is the benefit of this mod when I'm using CapCom - Mission Control On The Go already?

Edited December 4, 2019 by VoidSquid
@VoidSquid none

Curious, I just ran into an issue with this. After completing a set of about five part test contracts in one mission, now no contracts are showing in the window anymore. I double checked and I have active contracts, but the mod's window shows none of them. I tried accepting some new contracts to see if it was something to do with the existing contracts, but the new ones are also not showing up. I've used CW+ since I started playing KSP way back at 1.0 and I've never seen this happen. Any ideas? I tried searching but not finding this issue. Any suggestions? I use this extensively in part testing contracts to make sure I've met all the needed conditions.

On 1/7/2020 at 2:11 AM, kananesgi said:

Curious, I just ran into an issue with this. After completing a set of about five part test contracts in one mission, now no contracts are showing in the window anymore. I double checked and I have active contracts, but the mod's window shows none of them. I tried accepting some new contracts to see if it was something to do with the existing contracts, but the new ones are also not showing up. I've used CW+ since I started playing KSP way back at 1.0 and I've never seen this happen. Any ideas? I tried searching but not finding this issue. Any suggestions? I use this extensively in part testing contracts to make sure I've met all the needed conditions.

Were you able to fix the issue or did you uninstall the mod? Is it bugged?

On 4/8/2020 at 11:46 AM, Krzeszny said:

Were you able to fix the issue or did you uninstall the mod? Is it bugged?

My apologies, I didn't see this till just now. I simply stopped using the mod and started using the default contracts toolbar button. Less convenient than CW+, but it works well enough. I haven't tried CW+ in months now.

On 4/8/2020 at 11:46 AM, Krzeszny said:

Is it bugged?

I've been using it mostly successfully in 1.9.1. The only issue I run into is that periodically the window resets to default sorting. All contracts are open and any mission sets are gone and hidden contracts are back on the main list.

I gave up on mission sets as setting them up again is a nuisance.  Usually I just hide contracts not actively waiting on me to do something like survey contracts just waiting out a number of days in orbit. I haven't noticed what circumstance triggers a reset and looking through this thread it's been a reported problem in the past, but hadn't been commented on in a couple years.

Seeing a start-up error with v9.4 on KSP 1.10.1. 

[ERR 23:09:41.374] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: ContractsWindow.Unity, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

[ERR 23:09:41.420] ADDON BINDER: Cannot resolve assembly: ContractsWindow.Unity, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

https://github.com/DMagic1/KSP_Contract_Window/issues/50
I've installed ver 9.4 on KSP 1.11.1, I did see the addon binder error in the log but I didn't see any issue in game with it.

So is this working fine with 1.11 ? 

 

Edited March 5, 2021 by Kranvagn

Missing contract details?

Please compare the details provided for the "Explore Minmus" contract in the pictures below. The part of the contract that says: "At least one scientist assures us that we won't bring back any harmful contaminants"  is missing in the VAB or on the launchpad but is shown in the Space Center window. Am I missing a setting or option somewhere?

On 3/4/2021 at 4:05 PM, Kranvagn said:

So is this working fine with 1.11 ? 

Seems OK for 1.11.1. I believe addon binder errors at startup can all be ignored (based on some discussion with Lisias). I got a "key not found in dictionary" exception with 1.11.0 but I got that once with KAC too. So I guess Squad must have fixed whatever caused that.

If anyone is having issues trying to cycle thru created missions and back to all contracts i believe it's fixed if you go to the settings and check the option "Use Stock UI Style", i am unable to say if this is a bug i caused myself due to other mods, or if it comes from this one... but if it works, it works!

Got a tiny issue... I can only see the mission window when I'm not on a loaded vessel. So only in the KSC, VAB... I can toggle it working perfectly but on the mission, whilst I'm on the vessel, flying, in space, wherever I am with a loaded vessel or kerbal it just won't show up  

Edit: I SOLVED IT

Create a new career game, add some contracts and toggle the contract window in both the KSC and on a loaded vessel. Copy and paste the contract window lines in the persistent.sfs files  

Edited May 2, 2021 by adriangm44
Solved Issue

@DMagicI want a functionallity very similar to the one provided by this mod. I'd like to modify/overhaul it to fit my needs.
My account is too fresh to send a PM though, would you start a conversation please?

Hi there, can anybody confirm the mod works for KSP 1.12.3?

I installed mod v8.1 from CKAN and my KSP version 1.12.3.3173. I can see the icon of the mod in the toolbar at KSC and in flight. But when I click it, nothing happens or appears. Is there any way how to check logsf or errors?

Thanks.

---- Update ----
I think i faced some weird CKAN effect. To troubleshoot I created a separate installation with no mods and installed Contracts Window+. it worked. But turns out for that installation CKAN installed mod v 9.4. And for my first installation it showed that the latest is 8.1(which is not working.)
I tried to dig deeper why CKAN showed me 8.1.
If I set `compatible game versions` to 1.10, 1.11, 1.12 -> it will show the latest version 8.1
If I set `compatible game versions` to 1.8, 1.10, 1.11, 1.12 -> it will show the latest version 9.4

I'm not sure how it all works and what metadata is involved, but seems like some misconfig. Can you please check and fix if required?

Edited February 5, 2022 by serg.bloim
Update

It works on 1.12.3. I have:

  1. Contracts Window+ 9.4
  2. Contract Parser 9.0
  3. Progress Parser 11.0

None of them should show compatibility with 1.9+... they haven't been updated since 1.8.

1 hour ago, Krazy1 said:

It works on 1.12.3. I have:

  1. Contracts Window+ 9.4
  2. Contract Parser 9.0
  3. Progress Parser 11.0

None of them should show compatibility with 1.9+... they haven't been updated since 1.8.

@Krazy1 Thanks for checking. I think I resolved my issue.
My problem was  I didn't notice I have compatibility for 1.3 for some mod. And it caused this strange version filtering for me.
